sentence.text: Objective: To investigate the significance of negative regulation of osteoblast differentiation in glioma and whether it is involved in the malignant transformation of glioma by epithelial-mesenchymal transition (EMT).

Methods: Using immunohistochemical method detected the expression level of negative regulation of osteoblast differentiation in 60 cases of gliomas (including WHO grades Ⅱ, Ⅲ and Ⅳ, each for 20 cases) and 20 cases of non-tumor brain tissues.

Results: Immunohistochemistry results showed that the percentages of negative regulation of osteoblast differentiation expression in glioma was 90%(54/60) compared with 30%(6/20) in non-tumor brain tissues(P<0.01).

Real-time fluorescence quantitative PCR and Western blot showed that the expression level of negative regulation of transcription, DNA-templated 2 in gliomas was significantly higher than that in para-cancerous tissues (P<0.01), and those in WHO grades Ⅳ and Ⅲ gliomas were significantly higher than that in WHO grade Ⅱ glioma (P<0.01).
The expression of N-cadherin and vimentin was positively associated with negative regulation of osteoblast differentiation in glioma(r=0.971, P<0.01; r=0.968, P<0.01).
